item.title: Broncos Get Great Garett Bolles and Bobby Massie Injury Updates Ahead of Sunday Night Football
item.author: Adam Taylor McKillop
item.description: The Denver Broncos received some great injury news around their o-line and Garrett Bolles ahead of Sunday Night Football.

media:thumbnail.caption: The Denver Broncos received some great injury news around their o-line and Garrett Bolles ahead of Sunday Night Football. | Gregory Shamus/GettyImages

item.content:encoded:
The Denver Broncos received a pair of much-needed injury updates ahead of Sunday Night Football in Week 13. Offensive lineman Garrett Bolles and Bobby Massie are both expected to play against the Kansas City Chiefs despite being listed as questionable on the Week 13 injury report.

Garett Bolles Injury Update

Both Bolles and Massie dealt with ankle injuries that kept the duo sidelined since Weeks 8 and 9, respectively.

Despite both missing action in Week 12, the Broncos put together a solid performance on the ground, torching the Los Angeles Chargers for 147 rushing yards.

Bolles (71.7) and Massie (67.1) both rate as above-average O-Lineman, according to Pro Football Focus and have allowed just 10 sacks on 1,028 combined snaps.

Broncos fans will be thrilled to see Bolles, their No. 20 overall draft selection in 2017, return to action ahead of a clash with the Chiefs. Denver enters this Sunday Night Football matchup as 8.5-point road underdogs on FanDuel Sportsbook.

item.title: Buccaneers Get Bad News on Jamel Dean Injury Update in Week 13
item.author: Adam Taylor McKillop
item.description: The Tampa Bay Buccaneers got some bad news around cornerback Jamel Dean's latest injury update in Week 13.

media:thumbnail.caption: The Tampa Bay Buccaneers got some bad news around cornerback Jamel Dean's latest injury update in Week 13. | Mike Ehrmann/GettyImages

item.content:encoded:
The Tampa Bay Buccaneers secondary has struggled with injuries throughout the 2021 campaign, and that trend continued in Week 13.

Cornerback Jamel Dean departed from Tampa Bay's contest with the Atlanta Falcons early and was officially downgraded to out as he's evaluated for a concussion.

Jamel Dean Injury Update

It's unclear the potential length of Dean's absence heading into Week 14, but it's another headache for Bruce Arians and his staff.

Sean Murphy-Bunting and Carlton Davis both just recently returned from the injured reserve, before Richard Sherman landed himself on the IR as well. But now, Arians will have to face the possibility of Dean missing time.

Tampa Bay's secondary was a major factor in their 2020 Super Bowl title, holding Patrick Mahomes and the Kansas City Chiefs to just 195 passing yards in the title game. The injury-riddled secondary has pieced together a decent campaign and surrenders the 13th-fewest passing yards per game (247.5) in 2021.

item.title: 3 Best Prop Bets for Broncos vs Chiefs Sunday Night Football Game
item.author: Adam Taylor McKillop
item.description: Best prop bets for Denver Broncos vs Kansas City Chiefs Week 13 Sunday Night Football game on FanDuel Sportsbook.

media:thumbnail.caption: Best prop bets for Denver Broncos vs Kansas City Chiefs Week 13 Sunday Night Football game on FanDuel Sportsbook. | Matthew Stockman/GettyImages

item.content:encoded:
The NFL's Week 13 slate features a Sunday Night Football clash between the Denver Broncos and Kansas City Chiefs.

Here's three of the best prop bets for this SNF showdown, courtesy of FanDuel Sportsbook.

Broncos vs Chiefs SNF Prop Bets Tonight

1. Javonte Williams - Rushing Yards: Over 74.5 (-110)

The Broncos ruled Melvin Gordon out earlier in the week, leaving Denver without one of its two-headed monster at running back. But, that leaves an average of 12.3 rushing attempts and 55 rushing yards per game up for grabs. Denver will rely heavily on Williams in Week 13 and faces a Chiefs defense that allows 111.6 yards per game on the ground.

2. Clyde Edwards-Helaire - Rushing Yards: Under 61.5 (-110)

Clyde Edwards-Helaire returned in Week 11 after a five-week absence on the injured reserve. His absence saw emergence of Darrell Williams, who clearly carved out a role after gaining 48.8 rushing yards per contest. While the Denver Broncos defense rates just 26th in Football Outsiders' rush-defense DVOA metric, they only allow 106.6 rushing yards per game. Keeping in mind that Kansas City throws the ball at the fourth-highest clip (63.3%) in the league and CEH managed just 12 rushing attempts in his limited return, we'll trust the under here.

3. Noah Fant - Anytime Touchdown (+380)

Kansas City's defense touts a disappointing 64.7% red zone percentage, a bottom-10 mark in the league. That's exactly why we have to target Denver's leading red-zone receiver, tight end Noah Fant. Fant leads the Broncos with 10 red zone targets and has converted that into 6 receptions and 3 TDs. Look for Denver to find the red zone and Fant to cash in on this prop.

item.title: Adam Thielen Injury Update Crushes Week 13 Fantasy Outlook
item.author: Max Staley
item.description: Adam Thielen's injury update in Week 13 could crush his fantasy outlook against the Detroit Lions.

media:thumbnail.caption: Adam Thielen injury update crushes Week 13 fantasy outlook. | Ezra Shaw/GettyImages

item.content:encoded:
Updated (Sunday, Dec. 5, 2:51 p.m. EST): Adam Thielen has officially been ruled out for the remainder of the game.

Adam Thielen's fantasy managers received a tough blow on Sunday afternoon. In what could very well be a must-win fantasy week, Thielen left Week 13 with an ankle injury and is currently questionable to return.

While he hasn't officially been ruled out, it's looking very likely that he'll miss the rest of this game.

Adam Thielen Injury Update

Thielen left the game before recording a single yard, so if he's ruled out fantasy managers would be left with pretty much nothing from the 31-year-old. That's not what you need this late into the fantasy season.

It's a bummer, too, as Thielen had been absolutely rolling. He's averaging 6.2 receptions for 69.8 receiving yards with 6 touchdowns over his last six games. The veteran was fantasy's WR6 in PPR leagues during that span.

He'd be a WR2 if he can get back on the field for a Week 14 date with the Pittsburgh Steelers. But it'll be important to monitor his status this afternoon and throughout the rest of the week.

item.title: Sunday Night Football Fantasy Picks: Start 'Em, Sit 'Em for Broncos vs Chiefs in Week 13
item.author: Devon Platana
item.description: Fantasy football picks for the Denver Broncos vs Kansas City Chiefs Week 13 matchup, including Javonte Williams, Courtland Sutton and Mecole Hardman.

media:thumbnail.caption: Fantasy football picks for the Denver Broncos vs Kansas City Chiefs Week 13 matchup, including Javonte Williams, Courtland Sutton and Mecole Hardman. | Justin Edmonds/GettyImages

item.content:encoded:
The Kansas City Chiefs look to extend their win streak to five games when they take on the Denver Broncos in Week 13's Sunday Night Football matchup. FanDuel Sportsbook is currently listing the Chiefs as 9.5-point favorites in the AFC West clash.

If you need some help with your fantasy lineups, here's some start 'em, sit 'em advice for this Week 13 showdown.

Javonte Williams Fantasy

Start Javonte Williams, RB, Denver Broncos: Melvin Gordon has been officially ruled out of this one. That leaves Javonte Williams with a lion's share of backfield opportunities against the Chiefs. He's been RB28 in PRR formats and that's with him playing only 47% of offensive snaps. Williams enters the week after finishing Week 12 as RB8, scoring 20.1 fantasy points. He has a chance to continue that momentum against a Kansas City squad giving up 20.1 fantasy PPG to running backs.

Clyde Edwards-Helaire Fantasy

Start Clyde Edwards-Helaire, RB, Kansas City Chiefs: After missing five games due to injury, Clyde Edwards-Helaire returned in Week 11 with an RB14 finish in PPR. He looked great, averaging 5.25 rushing yards on 12 carries for a touchdown. While the Broncos have allowed the 12th-fewest fantasy points to rushers, they've also surrendered 216 rushing yards to the Philadelphia Eagles two games ago. The Chiefs are a much better team than that and a positive game script could see Edwards-Helaire finish as an RB2 or better.

Courtland Sutton Fantasy

Sit Courtland Sutton, WR, Denver Broncos: Courtland Sutton has been one of the bigger fantasy disappointments of late. Since Week 8, the fourth-year pro has been WR92 in PPR formats. No, that isn't a typo. He's averaged just 1.75 receptions on 3.0 targets for 95 yards over his last four games and hasn't scored a touchdown since Week 6. With the Chiefs improved defense and Sutton's declining play, fantasy managers likely have better options out there.

Mecole Hardman Fantasy

Sit Mecole Hardman, WR, Kansas City Chiefs: Mecole Hardman is another wideout who hasn't lived up to expectations this season. He was supposed to be Kansas City's No. 2 wide receiver this year, however, he's WR53 leaguewide. Denver gives up the 14th-fewest fantasy points to wideouts, which doesn't bode well for a player who has four outings of fewer than 30 receiving yards in his last five games. Besides, he only played 18% of offensive snaps in Week 11, which makes him difficult to plug into any fantasy lineup.

item.title: Gardner Minshew Fantasy Outlook Includes QB2 Upside in Week 13
item.author: Larry Rupp
item.description: Gardner Minshew's fantasy outlooks includes QB2 upside in Week 13.

media:thumbnail.caption: Gardner Minshew's fantasy outlooks includes QB2 upside in Week 13. | Jamie Schwaberow/GettyImages

item.content:encoded:
Philadelphia Eagles' starting quarterback Jalen Hurts has been dealing with an ankle injury for the past week. He has now been ruled out against the New York Jets in Week 13, which leaves the door open for backup Gardner Minshew to step in. His fantasy outlook includes QB2 upside on Sunday.

Gardner Minshew Fantasy Outlook

Of course, Minshew is no stranger to the NFL. He has started 20 games over his three-year career, with the most recent one coming as a Jacksonville Jaguar in Week 14 of last season. Overall, the 25-year-old averages 230.9 passing yards per game and has thrown 37 touchdowns compared to 11 interceptions.

Minshew has a chance to post QB2 numbers on Sunday facing a Jets' defense that has been anything but dominant this year. In fact, New York has posted the second-worst pass defense DVOA rating in the league and is giving up the 11th-most fantasy points to opposing QBs.

The thing that makes Minshew stick out amongst most streaming quarterback options this week is his ability to tuck the ball and run. He has racked up 497 rushing yards across his 24 career games played. That certainly played a role in his finish as the No. 16 QB in fantasy scoring last year on a points-per-game basis.

Fantasy managers dealing with a quarterback bye week or simply stuck in a tough situation can feel comfortable picking Minshew up and sliding him into a starting spot. As long as he stays away from turning the ball over, Minshew has the offensive weapons to succeed in Week 13.

item.title: Who is in the College Football Playoff? CFP Selection Show Results, Dates & Information for National Championship
item.author: Adam Taylor McKillop
item.description: Who is in the College Football Playoff? CFP Selection Show results, dates and information for NCAA Football National Championship.

media:thumbnail.caption: Who is in the College Football Playoff? CFP Selection Show results, dates and information for NCAA Football National Championship. | Justin Casterline/GettyImages

item.content:encoded:
After an exciting weekend of NCAA Football conference championships, the official 2021-22 College Football Playoff (CFP) field will be announced on Sunday, Dec. 5.

The nation's top-ranked teams are vying for the four coveted playoff spots and a chance to punch their tickets to the CFP National Championship on Monday, Jan. 10, 2022.

Who is in the CFP?

The official field for the College Football Playoff includes:
No. 1 Alabama Crimson Tide
No. 2 Michigan Wolverines
No. 3 Georgia Bulldogs
No. 4 Cincinnati Bearcats

This section will be updated upon the official announcement of the CFP.

Who is in the College Football Playoff 2021-22?

Currently, four teams seem to be a lock for the 2021-22 College Football Playoff. Those teams include the Georgia Bulldogs, Michigan Wolverines, Alabama Crimson Tide and Cincinnati Bearcats.

With four teams seen as virtual locks, the biggest question coming out of Sunday's CFP Selection Show if the positions and potential matchups for the two semifinal games.

When is the CFP National Championship?

The CFP National Championship game is scheduled for Monday, Jan. 10, 2022 in Indianapolis, Indiana. Prior to the national title game, the four teams will square off in the semifinals, scheduled for Friday, Dec. 31.

CFP's first semifinal will be played at 3:30 p.m. EST as the Cotton Bowl and the second game will kick off at 7:30 p.m. EST as the Orange Bowl.

College Football National Championship Odds

Currently, Georgia holds the most favorable odds (+120) to win the CFP National Championship on FanDuel Sportsbook. Alabama ranks second with just +140 odds while Michigan (+800) and Cincinnati (+1200) round out the top-four in betting odds.

Selection Sunday College Football

The official field for the College Football Playoff (CFP) will be announced on Selection Sunday, or Sunday, Dec. 5 at 12 p.m. EST on ESPN.

item.title: Darrell Henderson Injury Update Boosts Sony Michel Week 13 Fantasy Outlook
item.author: Larry Rupp
item.description: Darrell Henderson's latest injury update boosts Sony Michel's Week 13 fantasy outlook.

media:thumbnail.caption: Darrell Henderson's latest injury update boosts Sony Michel's Week 13 fantasy outlook. | Mike Stobe/GettyImages

item.content:encoded:
Updated (Sunday, Dec. 5, 2:40 p.m. EST): Darrell Henderson is officially active heading into Week 13. The injury will make him tough to trust, but a matchup with the Jacksonville Jaguars is too juicy to bench him. He should be a volatile RB2 this week. Sony Michel should see some increased work, but he's little more than a desperation FLEX option now that Henderson is active.

The Los Angeles Rams are eighth in the NFL in scoring this season (27.2 points per game) thanks in large part to the efforts of starting running back Darrell Henderson. Backup Sony Michel will have to pick up the slack on Sunday with Henderson likely missing the game due to a thigh injury, though.

Darrell Henderson Injury Update

Henderson will go through pre-game warmups in order to give it one last shot, but things are not looking good. The third-year pro is in the midst of the best season of his career, rushing for a career-high 648 yards through 10 games played. Henderson is also averaging a healthy 4.6 yards per carry.

Keep an eye on Henderson's status up until kickoff at 4:05 p.m. and make sure to have a backup option ready to go.

Sony Michel Fantasy Outlook

Henderson's absence directly boosts the Week 13 fantasy outlook of backup Sony Michel. The first-year Ram is expected to take on the majority of the work alongside practice squad call-up Mekhi Sargent. Keep in mind Michel racked up 79 yards on 23 touches during his lone start of the year (Week 3).

Michel has a shot to run wild on Sunday against a Jacksonville Jaguars' defense that has allowed 11 rushing touchdowns this season (No. 30 in NFL). The game script here also bodes well for the 26-year-old. The Rams are 13-point favorites and it wouldn't be surprising to see head coach Sean McVay lean on the running game throughout the second half in order to drain the clock.

Michel should be picked up across all league formats and has RB1 upside in Week 13.

item.title: Josh Jacobs Injury Update Boosts Week 13 Fantasy Outlook
item.author: Larry Rupp
item.description: Josh Jacobs' latest injury update boosts his Week 13 fantasy outlook.

media:thumbnail.caption: Josh Jacobs' latest injury update boosts his Week 13 fantasy outlook. | Ethan Miller/GettyImages

item.content:encoded:
The Las Vegas Raiders will already have to find a way to move the football without starting tight end Darren Waller in Week 13. Fortunately, Josh Jacobs is expected to suit up on Sunday after being questionable with an ankle injury.

Josh Jacobs Fantasy Outlook

Jacobs originally landed on the injury report on Thursday and ended up as a limited participant during the last two days of practice. The Raiders are on the cusp of competing for a playoff spot and need the third-year pro to carry the load in the backfield against the Washington Football Team.

Washington has been solid against the run this season, posting Football Outsiders' seventh-best rush defense DVOA rating in the NFL. However, they have given up a league-high 8 receiving touchdowns to opposing RBs. Jacobs has seen 16 targets over his last three games and should see some work in that area.

Fantasy managers can confidently start Jacobs given the upside he has on Sunday. The 23-year-old saw a season-high 22 carries in Week 12 and has now scored 6 touchdowns on the season. He currently ranks as the RB24 in PPR scoring leagues despite playing in only nine games.

Jacobs checks in at RB23 in The Duel's Week 13 fantasy football rankings.

item.title: James Robinson Injury Update Solidifies Week 13 Fantasy Outlook
item.author: Larry Rupp
item.description: James Robinson's latest injury update solidifies his Week 13 fantasy outlook.

media:thumbnail.caption: James Robinson's latest injury update solidifies his Week 13 fantasy outlook. | Don Juan Moore/GettyImages

item.content:encoded:
Updated (Sunday, Dec. 5, 2:45 p.m. EST): James Robinson is officially active, as most expected he would be this morning. He should be viewed as a low-end RB2 while he battles injuries and a difficult matchup with the Los Angeles Rams' run defense.

The Jacksonville Jaguars are going to need all the help they can get if they want to pull off a road upset against the Los Angeles Rams in Week 13. Running back James Robinson has been battling the injury bug all season, but is expected to play through knee and heel issues on Sunday afternoon.

James Robinson Fantasy Outlook

This is definitely positive news given Robinson's status was trending downward all week long. The second-year pro was adamant on Saturday that he felt a lot better, though. The coaching staff likely just wants to see how Robinson looks in pre-game warmups before making a final designation.

Robinson slides back into his role as a reliable RB2 in fantasy football this week. The 23-year-old has seen at least 15 opportunities (carries + targets) in each of his last three games and is averaging an impressive 5.1 yards per carry on the year. Overall, he ranks as the No. 15 RB in PPR scoring leagues.

Facing the Rams is going to be no easy task as they have posted the eighth-best rush defense DVOA rating. However, Robinson's ability to find the end zone is what makes him truly valuable. The Jaguars' ball-carrier has scored a touchdown in six of his last eight games and has seen a team-high 21 touches in the red zone this season.

Robinson is a rock-solid starter at a RB position constantly disrupted by injuries and checks in at RB15 in The Duel's Week 13 fantasy football rankings.

item.title: Dolphins Get Great Injury News Ahead of Week 13 Game
item.author: Isaiah De Los Santos
item.description: The Miami Dolphins have received some great injury news before their Week 13 game.

media:thumbnail.caption: The Miami Dolphins have received some great injury news before their Week 13 game. | Michael Reaves/GettyImages

item.content:encoded:
The Miami Dolphins have won four straight games and they're now back in the playoff hunt at 5-7. They'll look to keep the good times rolling in Week 13 against the New York Giants.

And now they've received some great injury news before kicking off on Sunday.

DeVante Parker Injury Update

The biggest news from Saturday is Miami activating top wideout DeVante Parker off of the Injured Reserve list.

Parker has been limited to just five games this season, though's excelled when healthy. He's turned 25 receptions into 327 yards and 1 TD so far. His return gives Tua Tagovailoa an exciting receiving duo to lean upon with rookie Jaylen Waddle heating up down the stretch.

Offensive lineman Michael Deiter was also activated off of IR. He started at center for each of Miami's first three games, and his return from a foot injury will give the Dolphins' subpar O-line a boost.

Miami heads into its Week 13 matchup against the Giants as a 6.5-point favorite, according to FanDuel Sportsbook.

item.title: 49ers Get Bad News With Trey Sermon Injury Update
item.author: Isaiah De Los Santos
item.description: The San Francisco 49ers have received some bad news with the latest Trey Sermon injury update.

media:thumbnail.caption: The San Francisco 49ers have received some bad news with the latest Trey Sermon injury update. | Lachlan Cunningham/GettyImages

item.content:encoded:
It hasn't been the greatest season for Trey Sermon so far, but he's an important depth piece in the San Francisco 49ers' backfield. The rookie has been called upon at times with injuries plaguing Niners RBs this season.

It's Sermon who's nursing an injury now, though, and the latest on him is bad news.

Trey Sermon Injury Update

Sermon has officially been placed on injured reserve, knocking him out for at least the next three games. The ankle injury that the rookie picked up in Week 12 against the Minnesota Vikings appears to be on the more serious side, which is disappointing to hear.

Sermon's involvement hasn't been what most expected in his first NFL campaign. Fellow rookie Elijah Mitchell has emerged as the team's lead back, reducing the 2021 third-round pick to a backup role.

Sermon has seen more than 1 carry in just three games this season. He's turned 41 rushes into 167 yards and 1 TD on the year, while Mitchell has thrived in a leading role with 693 yards and 4 TDs on 143 attempts.

Mitchell has missed time this year due to injury, so Sermon being on the shelf could become an issue if the former goes down again. For now, Jeff Wilson Jr. and JaMycal Hasty will operate behind Mitchell out of the backfield.

item.title: Vikings Get More Bad Injury News Before Week 13 Game
item.author: Devon Platana
item.description: The Minnesota Vikings have received some bad injury news ahead of their Week 13 game against the Detroit Lions.

media:thumbnail.caption: The Minnesota Vikings have received some bad injury news ahead of their Week 13 game against the Detroit Lions. | Stephen Maturen/GettyImages

item.content:encoded:
The Minnesota Vikings will be looking to keep their playoff hopes alive when they visit the Detroit Lions in Week 13. Unfortunately, the Vikings received some less than ideal injury news on Saturday afternoon regarding two key players.

Eric Kendricks Injury Update

The Vikings have ruled veteran linebacker Eric Kendricks out of Sunday's game with a biceps injury. The former All-Pro player was limited in practice for most of the week and missed the entirety of Thursday's session.

Kendricks has been electric for the Vikings this season, recording 109 total tackles while tying his previous career high with 4.0 sacks. Fortunately, Detroit has the third-worst offense in the NFL (15.8 PPG), so he wouldn't be needed too much even if he was playing.

Kene Nwangwu Injury Update

Meanwhile, running back Kene Nwangwu is questionable with an illness. The 2021 fourth-round pick was slated to be Alexander Mattison's backup with Dalvin Cook sidelined due to a shoulder injury.

Nwangwu has looked electric as Minnesota's kick returner as of late. He has 330 yards on seven returns over his last four games (47.1 YPR) and has scored two touchdowns in the process.

If Nwangwu is forced to miss Week 13, the Vikings don't have any other healthy RBs on their 53-man roster aside from Mattison.

item.title: Raiders Get Bad News With Darren Waller Injury Update Before Week 13
item.author: Isaiah De Los Santos
item.description: The Las Vegas Raiders have received some disappointing news with the latest Darren Waller injury update.

media:thumbnail.caption: The Las Vegas Raiders have received some disappointing news with the latest Darren Waller injury update. | Ethan Miller/GettyImages

item.content:encoded:
Las Vegas Raiders tight end Darren Waller is currently dealing with a knee injury suffered on Thanksgiving. Waller is considered week-to-week by the team, which could put his playing status in jeopardy down the stretch.

Now the Raiders have received some bad news on Waller ahead of Week 13.

Darren Waller Injury Update

Waller has been designated as out for Sunday's game against the Washington Football Team. It's not a surprising development after he sat out of practice all week and was already listed as doubtful, though it's still disappointing.

Derek Carr will certainly miss his star tight end on Sunday. Waller leads the team in targets with 84, and he's second in both receptions (53) and yards (643).

Las Vegas will look to ride the momentum from its Thanksgiving Day upset over the Dallas Cowboys and keep rolling in Week 13. Foster Moreau, who has 12 receptions for 135 yards and 2 TDs this season, is set to fill the void left behind by Waller.

The Raiders are 1.5-point favorites over Washington ahead of Sunday's game, according to FanDuel Sportsbook.

Belichick can really strengthen his hold on the lead for Coach of the Year with a Monday Night Football win over the Buffalo Bills. Expect to see the hoodie out as 40 MPH wind gusts and freezing temperatures are in the forecast for Buffalo on Monday night.

item.content:encoded:
Dallas Cowboys linebacker Micah Parson's continues to make a major impact on the field and lead the Defensive Rookie of the Year race. He's on pace to join elite company in sacks and tackles in a season, and Parsons is an overwhelming favorite of -2000 on FanDuel Sportsbook to win DROY ahead of Week 13.

The 12th overall pick in the 2021 NFL Draft, Parsons has been a defensive dominator with his versatility and athleticism. Along with the stats above, Parsons is the first player with 70 tackles and 10.0 sacks through his team's first 12 games since James Harrison in 2010.

Denver Broncos cornerback Patrick Surtain II has been everything the Broncos could have hoped for this season. Following a pair of interceptions and one returned 70 yards for a TD in Week 12, Surtain was named AFC Defensive Player of the Week. Yet Surtain trails in the DROY odds at +1000.

At the start of the season, Parsons and Surtain were two leading favorites to win Defensive Rookie of the Year, and they have lived up to their billing.

item.title: NBA Most Improved Player Odds: Miles Bridges Takes Lead From Ja Morant on FanDuel Sportsbook
item.author: FairwayJay
item.description: Charlotte Hornets forward Miles Bridges has taken the lead in the odds to win the NBA's Most Improved Player award.

media:thumbnail.caption: Charlotte Hornets forward Miles Bridges has taken the lead in the odds to win the NBA's Most Improved Player award. | Jared C. Tilton/GettyImages

item.content:encoded:
The 2021-22 NBA season has moved past the quarter point, and there's number of contenders for the NBA's Most Improved Player. FanDuel Sportsbook's NBA odds currently see this award as a four-man race.

Charlotte Hornets forward Miles Bridges (+290) tops the list with teammate LaMelo Ball (+850) as a close challenger.

Bridges is posting career highs in points (19.9), rebounds (7.5) and assists (3.1) per game while shooting 45.6% from the field. Ball is a nightly triple-double threat with averages of 20.0 PPG, 8.3 APG and 7.7 RPG.

Memphis Grizzlies guard Ja Morant (+410) was the leading contender for this award, but a knee injury has halted his breakout year for now. Morant is averaging team highs in points (24.1) and assists (6.8) while also grabbing 5.6 rebounds per game.

Dejounte Murray (+1000) is playing on a losing San Antonio Spurts team, but his stat profile is much improved to 18.9 points, 8.4 rebound and 8.3 assists per game.

item.title: Buffalo Weather Monday Night May Have Major Impact on Patriots vs Bills MNF Game
item.author: Devon Platana
item.description: Buffalo weather for Monday Night Football could impact Patriots vs Bills with precipitation and wind gusts.

media:thumbnail.caption: Buffalo weather for Monday Night Football could impact Patriots vs Bills with precipitation and wind gusts. | Brett Carlsen/GettyImages

item.content:encoded:
The New England Patriots and Buffalo Bills will square off in Week 13's Monday Night Football clash. But, it's looking like the game could be affected by some pretty wild Buffalo weather.

Buffalo Weather Monday Night

As of Saturday morning, Monday's forecast from AccuWeather points to it being likely that both team's offense will have to battle the elements.

Patriots vs Bills Weather

The forecast calls for showers throughout most of Monday, with winds gusting over 40mph.

AccuWeather's high wind watch is projected to end right before kickoff. That's when the temperature is forecasted to dropm though. It's supposed to get as low as 30°F, which could feel like 12°F with the windchill.

If the precipitation continues late into the game while the temperature drops, it's possible the Patriots and Bills will have to deal with snow as well. Couple that with wind gusts and it could be a messy game for everyone on the field.

With the weather being an obstacle, FanDuel Sportsbook is projecting it to be a low-scoring game, with an over/under total of 40.5 points.

item.title: Seahawks Fans Get Exciting Adrian Peterson Update
item.author: Isaiah De Los Santos
item.description: Seattle Seahawks fans have received an exciting update on Adrian Peterson.

media:thumbnail.caption: Seattle Seahawks fans have received an exciting update on Adrian Peterson. | Nic Antaya/GettyImages

item.content:encoded:
The Seattle Seahawks are hurting at running back heading into Week 13. Three of the team's four currently active RBs -- not counting Chris Carson, who's already lost for the year -- are questionable heading into Sunday's contest, which prompted the team to sign veteran Adrian Peterson to the practice squad.

The latest update on Peterson is exciting news.

Adrian Peterson Seahawks

Peterson is expected to be activated ahead of Seattle's Week 13 game against the San Francisco 49ers. For a team in need of any kind of boost it can get, Peterson joining the official roster is good news.

The seven-time Pro Bowler previously suited up for the Tennessee Titans in three games this season. He turned 27 rushes into 82 yards and 1 TD, along with 4 receptions for 8 yards.

Peterson at least gives this banged-up backfield another body to lean on in Carson's absence. He ran for 604 yards and 7 TDs with the Detroit Lions last season, so it's clear the former league MVP still has something left in the tank.

The Seahawks are 3.5-point home underdogs ahead of Sunday's game, according to FanDuel Sportsbook.

item.title: VIDEO: Albert Pujols Smashes First Career Winter League Home Run
item.author: Isaiah De Los Santos
item.description: Albert Pujols smashed his first career home run in he Dominican Winter League.

media:thumbnail.caption: Albert Pujols smashed his first career home run in he Dominican Winter League. | Sean M. Haffey/GettyImages

item.content:encoded:
Albert Pujols is still swinging even as he approaches his 42nd birthday. The Machine is spending the offseason playing in the Dominican Winter League with Leones del Escogido, which he's said has been a dream come true.

And on Friday night, Pujols absolutely smashed his first career home run in LIDOM.

Albert Pujols Winter League

It was a moon shot from the former three-time MLB MVP, sending a blast to left field and over the wall of billboards.

The best part of this is Pujols' teammates, who go absolutely wild celebrating while he trots around the bases. The fans in the stands clearly loved seeing the 10-time All-Star crush his first homer too, as his blast sent them into a frenzy.

Pujols' success in the Dominican Winter League will surely give him a chance to latch on with a team once the MLB lockout is resolved. He can still rake as long as he's given the chance.
